dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5848 IH: To prohibit the Administrator of the Small Business Administration from directly making loans under the 7(a) loan program, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Luetkemeyer (for himself, Mr. Williams of Texas, Mr. Meuser, Ms. Van Duyne, Mr. Bean of Florida, Mr. LaLota, and Mr. Alford) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Small Business

form.official-title: To prohibit the Administrator of the Small Business Administration from directly making loans under the 7(a) loan program, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any provision of subsection (a) of section 7 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 636(a)), the Administrator of the Small Business Administration may not directly make a loan pursuant to such subsection.

The Administrator of the Small Business Administration shall service a direct loan made under section 7(a) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 636(b)) if such loan was made before the date of the enactment of this Act.
